document.masterDocTitle: A review of Chelonian type specimens (order Testudines)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of Chelonian type specimens (order Testudines)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype :
MNHN 1934 ( Loveridge & Williams 1957:195 ; Bour & Maran 1999:30 ; Ceríaco & Bour 2012:19 ; photographed in Bour & Maran 1999:25); erroneously listed as MNHN 7934 in Iverson (1992:143) .

bibRefCitation.author: Schweigger, A. F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Schweigger, A. F. (1812) Prodromus monographiae Cheloniorum. Konigsberger Archiv fur Naturwissenschaft und Mathematik, 1, 271 - 368, 406 - 462.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype
: Not located; MNHN according to Bour & Maran (1999:28) , apparently lost.

bibRefCitation.author: Spix, J. B.
bibRefCitation.refString: Spix, J. B. (1824) Animalia Nova sive Species Novae Testudinum et Ranarum. Monachii, 53 pp.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype
: Not located, presumably once in ZSM ( Hoogmoed & Gruber 1983:351 ); illustrated in the original description ( Pl. X ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype
: Not located ( Bour & Maran 1999:28 ); although Gray (1873:36) reported a specimen of
Emys sigriz
in the BMNH (1858.6.1.45).

Syntypes
(20+): including BMNH 1988.79; OUM 8482-88, 8762 (Nowak-Kemp & Fritz 2010:12– 13 ; who identified 8482, 8484, 8488, and 8762 as
Mauremys leprosa
; 8483, 8485, and 8487 as
Mauremys rivulata
; and 8486 as
Mauremys mutica
); and RMNH 3327 (actually
M. rivulata
;
Hoogmoed et al. 2010:11
, photographed therein). Plate 4 (top) in Gray (1831) was designated lectotype (iconotype) by Fritz & Wishuf (1997:244, 249). BMNH 1988.79 was erroneously listed as the holotype by Bour & Maran (1999:30 ; see also Fritz & Wishuf 1997:244, 249), apparently because the BMNH catalogue indicates that specimen as holotype .

Syntypes
(5): BMNH 1947.3.4.43 (formerly 1848.8.22.9),1947.3.4.44(formerly1848.8.22.6), 1947.3.4.46, 1947.3.5.38-39 (formerly 1848.8.22.7-8); Bour & Maran 1999:28 ). One of syntypes presumably illustrated in Gray (1856 : Pl. IX ).

bibRefCitation.author: Gray, J. E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Gray, J. E. (1870) Supplement to the Catalogue of Shield Reptiles in the Collection of the British Museum. Part I. Testudinata (Tortoises). British Museum, London, 120 pp. https: // doi. org / 10.5962 / bhl. title. 11307

bibRefCitation.author: Gray, J. E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Gray, J. E. (1870) Supplement to the Catalogue of Shield Reptiles in the Collection of the British Museum. Part I. Testudinata (Tortoises). British Museum, London, 120 pp. https: // doi. org / 10.5962 / bhl. title. 11307

subSubSection.paragraph:
Syntypes
(4 according to Gray 1870 , but only 3 specimens known): BMNH 1946.1.22.31, 1946.1.22.43, and unnumbered (formerly 1861.10.1.4, 1870.12.22.7, and 1859.5.11.2; Bour & Maran 1999:29 ).
Emys fraseri Gray 1870:643

Syntypes
( 1 specimen according to Gray 1870 and Gray 1873:35 , but two specimens known): BMNH 1946.1.22.33-34 (formerly 1846.11.4.21- 22; Bour & Maran 1999:30 ).

bibRefCitation.author: Gray, J. E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Gray, J. E. (1873) Hand-List of the Specimens of Shield Reptiles in the British Museum. British Museum, London, 124 pp.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype
: Not located; possibly in the BMNH .
